auto_merge.commit_title: fix(lua): correct line number reporting for options set in coroutines (#37463)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fixes #37402

### Problem
Previously, `active_lstate` in `executor.c` often pointed to the main Lua thread, even when code was executing inside a coroutine. This caused `nlua_set_sctx` (used by `:verbose`) to inspect the wrong stack, resulting in incorrect 'last_set_linenr' reporting.

### Solution
This PR ensures the C-side `active_lstate` is always synchronized with the executing Lua thread during API calls.

- Create `active_lstate` and state-switching macros globally visible in `src/nvim/lua/executor.h`.
- Updated the API dispatch generator `src/gen/gen_api_dispatch.lua` to inject `ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE(lstate)` and `LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` into all generated C API wrapper functions.

This ensures that whenever Lua calls into C, the C layer knows exactly which Lua thread is active, allowing `debug.getinfo` to retrieve the correct line number.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: if we move the ENTER to be below all these preparing checks, we could avoid this extra LEAVE no ?
we call also avoid this if we delay the ENTER until after all args are parsed

`write_shifted_output()` reduces indent by 2, so the indent should be 4 spaces here.
```suggestion
  write_shifted_output('    ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE(lstate);\n')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -840,6 +840,8 @@ local function process_function(fn)
   else
     cparams = cparams:gsub(', $', '')
   end
+
+  write_shifted_output('  ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE(lstate);\n')

@@ -903,6 +905,7 @@ exit_0:
     -- NOTE: we currently assume err_throw needs nothing from arena
     write_shifted_output(
       [[
+      LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE();

comment_regular_data.body: #### I verified this locally with a reproduction script. The output is 4, 3, which confirms the fix: - 4: The current running line (from debug.getinfo). - 3: The last_set_linenr, which correctly identifies the line where the option was modified inside the coroutine. ```lua vim.o.verbose = 1 coroutine.wrap(function() vim.o.busy = 2 print(debug.getinfo(1, 'Snl').currentline) print(vim.api.nvim_get_option_info2('busy', {}).last_set_linenr) end)() ```
Are the `ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` and `LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` calls in lua/executor.c needed? These are calling from C into Lua, not from Lua into C.

> Are the `ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` and `LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` calls in lua/executor.c needed? These are calling from C into Lua, not from Lua into C.

Let me check again quickly

> Are the `ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` and `LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` calls in lua/executor.c needed? These are calling from C into Lua, not from Lua into C.



> > Are the `ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` and `LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` calls in lua/executor.c needed? These are calling from C into Lua, not from Lua into C.
> 
> Let me check again quickly

Yes they are needed, otherwise the 'active_lstate' will NULL by default.

> Yes they are needed, otherwise the 'active_lstate' will NULL by default.

Why will it be NULL by default? Isn't it set to the same value as `global_lstate` in `nlua_init()`?

> Are the `ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` and `LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()` calls in lua/executor.c needed? These are calling from C into Lua, not from Lua into C.

I originally added them to ensure active_lsate was initialized before lua code ran, but since (Lua -> C) handles the state explicitly, now those lines are redundant. Sorry for the inconvenience. I will remove them now
I removed the redundant 'ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()' and 'LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()' calls in lua/executor.c. Thanks for you advice and support.
Please add a new test case to test/functional/ex_cmds/verbose_spec.lua (just add a piece of code to the end of `script_file` and then add a corresponding `it()` block below).
It seems that you accidentally squashed your commit into the previous one on master.
Moved 'ENTER_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()' right before the API call and add 'LEAVE_LUA_ACTIVE_STATE()' in side 'if (!nlua_is_deferred_safe())'.
Rebased on master and applied the suggested optimization, thanks to @bfredl.
Fixed commit message formatting to pass lint checks.
